Plays > The Nunobiki Waterfall

– Click image to view.

The Nunobiki Waterfall

(源平布引滝) (Genpei Nunobiki no taki)

Written By: Namiki Senryū (See also Namiki Namiki Sōsuke) (並木千柳) , Miyoshi Shōraku (三好松洛)

First Staged: 1749

Reference: Hironaga, Shūzaburō, The Bunraku Handbook (Tokyo: Maison des Arts, 1976); Kokuritsu Gekijō jōen shiryōshū, edited by Kokuritsu Gekijō Geinō Chōsashitsu, vol. 194, September 1981; Bunraku October 1974 Performance Program

Kashira:

Yokanbei (与勘平)

Kenbishi (検非違使)

Genta (源太)

Kuchiaki Bunshichi (口あき文七)

Ōdanshichi (大団七)

Darasuke (jidai) (陀羅助（時代）)

Musume (娘)

Takeuji (武氏)

Fukeoyama (老女形)

Koyaku (子役)

Oniwaka (鬼若)

Sanmaime (kani) (三枚目（かに）)

Hanaugoki (鼻動き)

Hagataki (端敵)

Wakaotoko (若男)

Kintoki (金時)

Bunshichi (文七)

Baba (sewa) (婆（世話）)

Ōshūto (大舅)

Hayaku (端役)

Darasuke (陀羅助)

Ofuku (お福)

Komusume (小娘)

Matahei (又平)

Yūsen (祐仙)

Tsume (つめ)

Otoko tsume (男つめ)

Otoko koyaku (男子役)

Onna koyaku (女子役)

Performances:

November 1970: The Nunobiki Waterfall

October 1974: The Nunobiki Waterfall

July 1980: The Nunobiki Waterfall

September 1981: The Nunobiki Waterfall

August 1985: The Nunobiki Waterfall

July 1986: The Nunobiki Waterfall

July 1990: The Nunobiki Waterfall

November 1993: The Nunobiki Waterfall

December 1993: The Nunobiki Waterfall

Scenes:

Shingen's Mansion (武田信玄館)

Messenger Yoshikiyo's Visit (村上義清上使)

Katsuyori Kills Himself (勝頼切腹)

Shingen's Talk (信玄物語)

The Drug Peddlers' Journey (道行似合の女夫丸)

Bewitched by a Fox (和田別所化性屋敷)

The Death of Dosan (道三最期)

The Itodo Myojin Shrine (射手明神)

Yoshinaka's Mansion (義仲館)

Messenger Kagekatsu's Visit (See also Kenshin's Mansion) (景勝上使 (See also 謙信館）)

The Delivery of the Rifle (See also Kenshin's Mansion) (鉄砲渡し (See also 謙信館))

Kenshin's Mansion (See also Messenger Kagekatsu's Visit and the Delivery of the Rifle) (謙信館 (see akso 景勝上使 and 鉄砲渡し))

Characters:

Naritada, a court noble (大納言成忠)

Suemune, a Heike clansman (長田太郎末宗)

Yoshikata, a Genji general (木曾先生義賢)

Emperor Goshirakawa (後白河天皇)

Kiyomori, Head of the Heike clan (安芸守平清盛)

Tsunetoshi, a Heike clansman (難波六郎常俊)

Shigemori, Son of Kiyomori (平重盛 (小松内府重盛))

Nagatsune (高橋判官長常)

Yukitsuna, a Genji warrior (多田蔵人行綱)

Aoi-Gozen, Yoshikata's wife (葵御前)

Matsuyoi, Yoshikata's daughter (待宵姫)

Kurosuke, a farmer (百姓九郎助)

Koman, Kurosuke's daughter (女房小まん)

Tarokichi, Koman's son (伜太郎吉)

Munemasa, a Heike warrior (進野次郎宗政)

Heinai, Munemasa's retainer (横田平内)

Gunzo, Munemasa's retainer (軍蔵)

Chuta, a Heike warrior (塩見忠太)

Munemori, Son of Shigemori (平宗盛)

Saemon, a Heike general (飛騨左衛門)

Sanemori, a Heike general (斎藤実盛)

Koyoshi, Kurosuke's wife (九郎助女房小よし)

Nisota, Kurosuke's nephew (矢橋二惣太)

Seno-o, a Heike warrior (瀬尾十郎)

Village headman (庄屋)

Matsunami Kengyo (松波検校)

Reisui, a highway robber (谷川冷水)

Kozakura, Yukitsuna's daughter (娘小桜)

Wakaba, a lady-in-waiting (若葉局)

Momiji, a lady-in-waiting (紅葉局)

Moritsugu, a Heike clansman (Etchu Jiro) (越中次郎盛次)

Tadamitsu, a Heike clansman (Kazusa Goro) (上総五郎忠光)

Boatman (船頭)
